Interface Angle

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Angle>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Degreef, Radianf
public interface Angle extends Comparable<Angle>
An angle is the figure formed by two rays sharing the same vertex end point and represents a measurement of the amount of rotation between them.
Author:
Raymond L. Rivera

    • div

      Angle div(Angle angle)
      Divides this angle by the specified angle.
      Parameters:
      angle - The angle to be used as the denominator.
      Returns:
      A new angle with the quotient.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If a division by zero takes place.

    • div

      Angle div(float scalar)
      Divides this angle by the specified scalar value.
      Parameters:
      scalar - The scalar value that will be used as the denominator.
      Returns:
      A new angle with the quotient.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If a division by zero takes place.

    • negate

      Angle negate()
      Returns a new instance that is the negation of this.

      Negation is the mathematical equivalent of: this * -1.0f.

      Returns:
      A new instance with the result of this negation.
